evidences.text: Last time we were talking about trying to evaluate intelligence of our AIs and what mechanisms we use to kind of evaluate them.

I would advocate that we want to use other mechanisms beyond this sort of raw intelligence, that it's not just a single dimensional vector, that we should be talking about emotional intelligence and other things as well.
But let's even just go with intelligence for a moment and try to assess how these things perform.
Like actually going back, we talked about earlier versions of GPT already pretty much embarrassed us on most tests.
There are certain tests that maybe you still have some problems with.
But there are certain things where it just completely crushes us.
And to be fair, there's not just one dimension to intelligence.
It shouldn't just be that, okay, it can solve chemistry stuff that I wouldn't have a chance at, so therefore it's better than me.
It can read poems that I can't understand, so it's better than me.
It's getting more emotional, intelligent, but there should be some more dimensions to it.
It's not going to be intelligent the same way that we are.
Maybe because the medium is different.
You know, it lacks the hormones that make our intelligence somewhat more emotionally intelligent than that.
It won't be the same sentient the same way that we are.
